name: identifiability
content:
identifiability noun [U]
(BE RECOGNIZED)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being able to be recognized or named: The concepts of anonymity, privacy, and identifiability are closely related. Protections against identifiability are important to assure the anonymity of the patient. Related words
identify
identifiable
More examplesFewer examplesWe reserve the right to vet contributions to avoid, for example, defamation, libel, sexism, racism or identifiability of subjects involved in studies.Donors should be warned that it is difficult to predict how personal information might be shared in the future, and they should be made aware of the inherent identifiability of DNA.This study is concerned with the identifiability of phrase boundaries across familiar and unfamiliar languages.

identifiability noun [U]
(IN SCIENCE)
science, social science
  specialized a quality in a statistical model which makes it possible to make correct inferences (= form correct opinions) based on the information in it: This method was used in assessing the identifiability of the final model.
More examplesFewer examplesAn obvious approach to generating identifiability is via the categorization of terms.Several findings emerge from our investigation of identifiability tests in linear instrumental variable models.
